decks.notes: The deck revolves around assembling the Amulet Titan combo, using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Urza's Saga to generate mana and search for key pieces. It aims to ramp quickly and efficiently, using bounce lands and lands like Lotus Field to generate additional mana and trigger landfall effects. It also includes utility lands like Gruul Turf and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect the combo. The deck can win quickly through ramping into Primeval Titan or Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, or by assembling the Scapeshift combo for a massive amount of damage.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating card advantage and potentially winning the game through a combo finish with Grinding Station and Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides additional graveyard recursion and Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Mox Amber help to accelerate mana production. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Preordain provide card selection, while disruption is provided by cards like Spell Pierce and Spell Snare. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt opponents to achieve victory.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By disrupting your opponent's game plan with spells like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, you can slow down their progress while building up your own resources with cards like Consider and Thought Scour. The win condition comes in the form of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog, which can quickly close out the game once you've gained control. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast your opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's board and hand, utilizing cards like Prismatic Ending, Fatal Push, and Bone Shards. It also incorporates graveyard hate with Leyline of the Void and Unearth for recurring threats. The deck aims to lock down opponents with Torpor Orb, Damping Sphere, and Stony Silence while deploying its own threats like Murktide Regent and Ketramose, the New Dawn. The inclusion of Pest Control and Psychic Frog adds additional disruption and card advantage, creating a versatile and resilient control strategy.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate into big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Karn, the Great Creator and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck can quickly ramp up its mana to cast powerful threats while also having ways to deal with opposing threats through removal and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, generating infinite combo loops to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a combination of cheap artifact spells, card draw engines, and mana acceleration, the deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces for the combo as efficiently as possible. By carefully managing resources and maximizing card advantage, the deck can ultimately win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on aggressively filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Goblin Lore to quickly get out powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Vengevine. Marauding Mako and Flameblade Adept provide additional aggressive threats, while Street Wraith and Detective's Phoenix offer card advantage. Fear of Missing Out can help push damage through, while Arena of Glory provides additional value. By efficiently utilizing the graveyard and cheap spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and explosive plays.
